Content.Knowledge Point: Cleaning and organizing your makeup kit
Content.Text: First, clean out your makeup kit by removing anything broken, expired, or smelly. Then, check the colors and keep only what you need. Organize your makeup into categories like day and night, and keep only the essentials in your everyday bag.

Embrace a minimalist approach to makeup, focusing on essentials like tinted balm, powder, and a customized palette with shadows and blush. Use a pencil for under-eye and spot coverage, and opt for a tinted lip balm or gloss instead of traditional lipstick.

Invest in efficient products like a multi-purpose compact with a mirror, highlighter, and lip color. Use a toothpaste pick for touch-ups and a spoolie for grooming eyebrows. Keep your bag organized with labeled containers and travel-sized items.

When traveling, depot your own makeup into small containers and label them for easy identification. Bring a makeup remover, cotton swabs, and hand sanitizer. Keep your bag compact and bring only the essentials to avoid clutter.
